trans-unit.source: Manage volume-purchased iOS apps | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage volume-purchased iOS apps | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Intune to manage apps that you volume purchased from Apple by importing the license information from the app store, tracking how many of the licenses you have used, and preventing you from installing more copies of the app than you own.
trans-unit.target: Use Intune to manage apps that you volume purchased from Apple by importing the license information from the app store, tracking how many of the licenses you have used, and preventing you from installing more copies of the app than you own.

trans-unit.source: Manage iOS apps you purchased through a volume-purchase program with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage iOS apps you purchased through a volume-purchase program with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: The iOS app store lets you purchase multiple licenses for an app that you want to run in your company.
trans-unit.target: The iOS app store lets you purchase multiple licenses for an app that you want to run in your company.

trans-unit.source: This helps you reduce the administrative overhead of tracking multiple purchased copies of apps.
trans-unit.target: This helps you reduce the administrative overhead of tracking multiple purchased copies of apps.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune helps you manage apps that you purchased through this program by importing the license information from the app store, tracking how many of the licenses you have used, and preventing you from installing more copies of the app than you own.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune helps you manage apps that you purchased through this program by importing the license information from the app store, tracking how many of the licenses you have used, and preventing you from installing more copies of the app than you own.

trans-unit.source: Currently, Intune assigns iOS Volume Purchase Program for Business (VPP) app licenses to users and not devices.
trans-unit.target: Currently, Intune assigns iOS Volume Purchase Program for Business (VPP) app licenses to users and not devices.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, users must enter their Apple ID password to install the app.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, users must enter their Apple ID password to install the app.

trans-unit.source: Manage volume-purchased apps for iOS devices
trans-unit.target: Manage volume-purchased apps for iOS devices

trans-unit.source: You purchase multiple licenses for iOS apps through the [Apple Volume Purchase Program for Business](http://www.apple.com/business/vpp/).
trans-unit.target: You purchase multiple licenses for iOS apps through the [Apple Volume Purchase Program for Business](http://www.apple.com/business/vpp/).

trans-unit.source: This involves setting up an Apple VPP account from the Apple website and uploading the Apple VPP token to Intune.
trans-unit.target: This involves setting up an Apple VPP account from the Apple website and uploading the Apple VPP token to Intune.

trans-unit.source: You can then synchronize your volume purchase information with Intune and track your volume-purchased app use.
trans-unit.target: You can then synchronize your volume purchase information with Intune and track your volume-purchased app use.

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: Before you start, you'll need to get a VPP token from Apple and upload this to your Intune account.
trans-unit.target: Before you start, you'll need to get a VPP token from Apple and upload this to your Intune account.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you should understand the following:
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you should understand the following:

trans-unit.source: Each organization can have only one VPP account and token.
trans-unit.target: Each organization can have only one VPP account and token.

trans-unit.source: After you associate an Apple VPP account to Intune, you cannot associate a different account later.
trans-unit.target: After you associate an Apple VPP account to Intune, you cannot associate a different account later.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, it's very important that more than one person has the details of the account that you use.
trans-unit.target: For this reason, it's very important that more than one person has the details of the account that you use.

trans-unit.source: If you previously used a VPP token with a different product, you must generate a new one to use with Intune.
trans-unit.target: If you previously used a VPP token with a different product, you must generate a new one to use with Intune.

trans-unit.source: Each token is valid for one year.
trans-unit.target: Each token is valid for one year.

trans-unit.source: By default, Intune syncs with the Apple VPP service twice a day.
trans-unit.target: By default, Intune syncs with the Apple VPP service twice a day.

trans-unit.source: You can start a manual sync at any time.
trans-unit.target: You can start a manual sync at any time.

trans-unit.source: After you have imported the VPP token to Intune, do not import the same token to any other device management solution.
trans-unit.target: After you have imported the VPP token to Intune, do not import the same token to any other device management solution.

trans-unit.source: Doing so might result in the loss of license assignment and user records.
trans-unit.target: Doing so might result in the loss of license assignment and user records.

trans-unit.source: Before you start to use iOS VPP with Intune, remove any existing VPP user accounts created with other mobile device management (MDM) vendors.
trans-unit.target: Before you start to use iOS VPP with Intune, remove any existing VPP user accounts created with other mobile device management (MDM) vendors.

trans-unit.source: Intune will not synchronize those user accounts into Intune as a security measure.
trans-unit.target: Intune will not synchronize those user accounts into Intune as a security measure.

trans-unit.source: Intune will only synchronize data from the Apple VPP service that Intune created.
trans-unit.target: Intune will only synchronize data from the Apple VPP service that Intune created.

trans-unit.source: You cannot deploy iOS VPP apps to devices that were enrolled using the Device Enrollment Protocol (DEP).
trans-unit.target: You cannot deploy iOS VPP apps to devices that were enrolled using the Device Enrollment Protocol (DEP).

trans-unit.source: To get and upload an Apple VPP token
trans-unit.target: To get and upload an Apple VPP token

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Volume Purchase Program**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **iOS and Mac OS X** > **Volume Purchase Program**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Apple VPP Account** link.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Apple VPP Account** link.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already, sign up for the Volume Purchase Program for Business.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already, sign up for the Volume Purchase Program for Business.

trans-unit.source: After you sign up, download the Apple VPP token for your account.
trans-unit.target: After you sign up, download the Apple VPP token for your account.

trans-unit.source: On the **Manage Apple Volume Purchase Program (VPP)** page of the Intune console, choose **Upload the VPP token**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Manage Apple Volume Purchase Program (VPP)** page of the Intune console, choose **Upload the VPP token**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Upload the VPP token** dialog box, enter or paste the VPP token name and your Apple ID, and then choose **Upload**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Upload the VPP token** dialog box, enter or paste the VPP token name and your Apple ID, and then choose **Upload**.

trans-unit.source: In the warning dialog box, check the box to indicate that you understand that you can't change to a different VPP account later, and then choose **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: In the warning dialog box, check the box to indicate that you understand that you can't change to a different VPP account later, and then choose **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Volume Purchase Program** page, you can now view information about the Apple VPP token, including when it was last updated, when it will expire, and when it was last synchronized with Intune.
trans-unit.target: On the **Volume Purchase Program** page, you can now view information about the Apple VPP token, including when it was last updated, when it will expire, and when it was last synchronized with Intune.

trans-unit.source: You can synchronize the data held by Apple with Intune at any time by choosing **Sync now**.
trans-unit.target: You can synchronize the data held by Apple with Intune at any time by choosing **Sync now**.

trans-unit.source: To deploy a volume-purchased app
trans-unit.target: To deploy a volume-purchased app

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Managed Software** > **Volume-Purchased apps**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Apps** > **Managed Software** > **Volume-Purchased apps**.

trans-unit.source: This list shows all apps that were synchronized from the Apple VPP service.
trans-unit.target: This list shows all apps that were synchronized from the Apple VPP service.

trans-unit.source: Choose the app that you want to deploy, choose **Manage Deployment**, and then use the instructions in the [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic to finish uploading, creation, and deployment of the app.
trans-unit.target: Choose the app that you want to deploy, choose **Manage Deployment**, and then use the instructions in the [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic to finish uploading, creation, and deployment of the app.

trans-unit.source: You must choose a deployment action of **Required**.
trans-unit.target: You must choose a deployment action of **Required**.

trans-unit.source: Available installations are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Available installations are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy the app as a **Required** installation, each user who installs the app uses a license.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy the app as a **Required** installation, each user who installs the app uses a license.

trans-unit.source: To reclaim a license, you must change the deployment action to **Uninstall**.
trans-unit.target: To reclaim a license, you must change the deployment action to **Uninstall**.

trans-unit.source: The license will be reclaimed after the app is uninstalled.
trans-unit.target: The license will be reclaimed after the app is uninstalled.

trans-unit.source: When a user with an eligible device first tries to install a VPP app, they will be asked to join the Apple Volume Purchase program.
trans-unit.target: When a user with an eligible device first tries to install a VPP app, they will be asked to join the Apple Volume Purchase program.

trans-unit.source: They must do this before the app installation proceeds.
trans-unit.target: They must do this before the app installation proceeds.

trans-unit.source: Look at the **VPP Terms Status** column to see the acceptance status for each user to whom the app was deployed.
trans-unit.target: Look at the **VPP Terms Status** column to see the acceptance status for each user to whom the app was deployed.

trans-unit.source: If there are no more licenses available, the deployment will fail.
trans-unit.target: If there are no more licenses available, the deployment will fail.

trans-unit.source: To monitor Apple VPP apps
trans-unit.target: To monitor Apple VPP apps

trans-unit.source: You can monitor which VPP apps have been deployed, and how many licenses are used, from the **Apps** workspace in the **Managed Software** > **Volume-Purchased Apps** node.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor which VPP apps have been deployed, and how many licenses are used, from the **Apps** workspace in the **Managed Software** > **Volume-Purchased Apps** node.

trans-unit.source: You can also use app **Filters** to examine the status of each app installation.
trans-unit.target: You can also use app **Filters** to examine the status of each app installation.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md)
